item.description:
At this time, scrub oaks already display their showy catkins, early blueberries are in full bloom, while hillside and highbush blueberries are about to burst into flower; leatherleaf frames the ponds with a frenzy of white foam. We will hunt for the evasive state flower, trailing arbutus.

Meet at Parking Lot 2 at the intersection of Three-Cornered Pond Rd. and Upper College Pond Rd (see the MSSF Forest Map (Summer) in "Files" under "More". Be prepared to make a 3-mile loop with frequent stops. Duration: at least 3 hrs. (maybe even more). Kids age 9+ are welcome. Friendly dogs are OK. Don't forget to pack water and a snack.
item.how_to_find_us: Look for Irina at Parking Lot 2
item.why: It is the start of another exciting flowering season in the Forest!

group.name: Friends of Myles Standish State Forest Meetup Group

item.name: Spring Plant Walk in MSSF with Irina Kadis
